title: How to Bend Fork Tines Back Into Shape

steps.headline: Place the fork into warm water to warm it up.
Remove from the water and quickly dry.
Wrap a cloth around the fork tines.
steps.description:
Squeeze the tines with a pair of pliers, placed over the cloth. Aim to gently bring the tines back into alignment. If the pliers aren't large enough to fit around the fork, lay the fork on its side and gently hammer the wrapped tines into alignment. Change the side being hammered to ensure evenness. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/82\/Bend-Fork-Tines-Back-Into-Shape-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Bend-Fork-Tines-Back-Into-Shape-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/82\/Bend-Fork-Tines-Back-Into-Shape-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Bend-Fork-Tines-Back-Into-Shape-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Place a wood or metal ruler between the tines.
Gently lever the ruler to bend the tine back into alignment with the original row.
steps.description: Do this in small, gentle movements rather than one big levering movement.

tyn: Pliers or small hammer (rubber hammer is best)
Ruler, wood or metal; plastic might snap
text:
Fix outward splayed tines Place the fork into warm water to warm it up. Remove from the water and quickly dry. Wrap a cloth around the fork tines. Squeeze the tines with a pair of pliers, placed over the cloth. Aim to gently bring the tines back into alignment. If the pliers aren't large enough to fit around the fork, lay the fork on its side and gently hammer the wrapped tines into alignment. Change the side being hammered to ensure evenness. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/82\/Bend-Fork-Tines-Back-Into-Shape-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Bend-Fork-Tines-Back-Into-Shape-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/82\/Bend-Fork-Tines-Back-Into-Shape-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Bend-Fork-Tines-Back-Into-Shape-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Fixing inward bent tines Place a wood or metal ruler between the tines. Gently lever the ruler to bend the tine back into alignment with the original row. Do this in small, gentle movements rather than one big levering movement.
sentences: Fix outward splayed tines Place the fork into warm water to warm it up.
Remove from the water and quickly dry.
Wrap a cloth around the fork tines.
Squeeze the tines with a pair of pliers, placed over the cloth.
Aim to gently bring the tines back into alignment.
If the pliers aren't large enough to fit around the fork, lay the fork on its side and gently hammer the wrapped tines into alignment.
Change the side being hammered to ensure evenness.

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Fixing inward bent tines Place a wood or metal ruler between the tines.
Gently lever the ruler to bend the tine back into alignment with the original row.
Do this in small, gentle movements rather than one big levering movement.
